content.description: Start hugging the block with a large right hand sidepull and  a smaller left. Compress your way up to the jug on the face and top out.
content.protection: Pads are necessary. The landing is a platform made of logs over a steep slope.
content.location: The south end of the area. The climb faces north. The block is slightly higher up on the cliff than the rest of the bouldering.

content.description: Beautiful slab climb on great rock in a great setting. There are 3 holds on the face prior to the top out. You start on two of them and use the other to reach the topout. Short but very fun.
content.location: The north end of the area. The climb faces south.

content.description: Climbs the steep obvious, broken up crack system to the small roof. The final boulder problem seems to be pretty hard! Good gear the whole way. Probably a line on the arete as well.
content.location: Right behind (south) of A Midsummer Nights Session. Faces north.

content.description: Starts to the left of Modern Art on a good right hand sidepull and a great left hand undercling. Climb up through the dihedral to the sloping ledge and top out.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. The landing drops a little as you climb left.
content.location: On the same boulder as Modern Art. Both climbs face south.

content.description: Climb the obvious crack on the overhanging column. This climb is great on gear. As far as I know, no one has bouldered it but it is possible. The landing is not very good.
content.protection: Lots of pads and spotters or trad gear.
content.location: The north end of the area. The crack faces north. The route starts on a rock platform.

content.description: Start matched on the curved edge in the middle of the slightly overhanging face. Make a couple moves with strange tension out to the arete  and up over the top.
content.location: South end of the area. The climb faces north on a small brown and green boulder.

content.description:
This area is between the Patience boulder and the Tibbs area. It has a lot of undone stuff including a trad route.

 GPS (google maps): 41.363034, -72.974505
